meanings.definition: To emit or send out radiation again.
meanings.sent1: The mirror reradiated the sunlight into the room.
meanings.sent2: The satellite reradiated the signals back to Earth.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball reradiated the colorful lights, creating a dazzling effect.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reradiated happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse reradiated its beacon, guiding ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: To reflect or scatter radiation in all directions.
meanings.sent1: The clouds reradiated the heat from the sun, keeping the earth cool.
meanings.sent2: The shiny surface reradiated the light in different angles.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy reradiated the ball in all directions, confusing the other dogs.
meanings.sent4: His laughter reradiated through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The prism reradiated the colors of the rainbow, painting the walls with hues.
